column4: Ok i'm using Wine and it makes the programs slightly transparent, How do I get rid of this it is quite annoying in counter-strike
what window manager are you using?
What do you mean window manager
I have compiz-fusion if thats what you mean
hmmm. not sure about that one. I know in Beryl you can force set ARGB visuals for it (had that problem with some apps like qemu, wine and SDL apps)
Where in beryl did you do that, cause Compiz-Fusion is beryl, beryl was just discontinued
you should have a similar option in compiz-fusion i guess
i need to start up my beryl session to check. can you give me a minute?
in Beryl its in "Window Management" -> "Set window attribs by various criteria" -> "Disable ARGB visual" and there I added "c:SDL_App:1" for example.
use xprop to get the window class needed
what do i type in the text box
never tried compiz-fusion so i can't help there. maybe try in #ubuntu-effects
i hope i pushed you in the right direction anyway. gonna switch back to ion3 now :)
